sentences.en: Do you think that there is any receptive audience for his remarks.
sentences.cn: 你觉得有人愿意接受他的言论吗？

sentences.en: Goya was one of the first painters to look for a wider audience for his work.
sentences.cn: 戈雅是最早为自己的作品寻找更多观赏者的画家之一。

sentences.en: He was granted an audience with the Pope.
sentences.cn: 他获准觐见教皇。

sentences.en: His audience consists predominantly of groups of rugby-club revellers.
sentences.cn: 他的观众主要是橄榄球俱乐部里那些纵酒作乐的人。

sentences.en: His audience had listened like children, spellbound by his words.
sentences.cn: 他的观众像孩子般倾听着，被他的话深深吸引了。

sentences.en: One member of the audience described the opera as ‘boring’.
sentences.cn: 有一名观众说这出歌剧“乏味”。

sentences.en: Say's writings reached a wide audience during his lifetime.
sentences.cn: 在塞伊有生之年，他的作品拥有大量的读者。

sentences.en: Seminar topics are chosen for their accessibility to a general audience.
sentences.cn: 研讨会内容是以普通听众容易理解为依据作出选择的。

sentences.en: She began to find a receptive audience for her work.
sentences.cn: 她开始为作品寻找知音。

sentences.en: Television programmes are essentially bait to attract an audience for advertisements.
sentences.cn: 从根本上说，电视节目就是吸引观众看广告的诱饵。

sentences.en: The audience are strangely subdued, clapping politely after each song.
sentences.cn: 观众们出奇地安静，只是在每首歌结束后报以礼貌性的掌声。

sentences.en: The audience began clapping and cheering.
sentences.cn: 观众开始鼓掌欢呼。

sentences.en: The book is not intended for a purely academic audience.
sentences.cn: 本书不是面向纯学术读者的。

sentences.en: The FA Cup Final's audience climbed to 12.3 million.
sentences.cn: 观看英格兰足总杯决赛的观众人数增加到1,230万。

sentences.en: The offending comment was in fact a heckle from an audience member.
sentences.cn: 这番冒犯性的话实际上是一名观众的诘难。

sentences.en: The president had an audience with the Pope in the Vatican.
sentences.cn: 总统在梵蒂冈谒见了教皇。

sentences.en: The response of the audience varied from outright rejection to warm hospitality.
sentences.cn: 观众反应不一，有人完全不能接受，也有人击掌叫好。

sentences.en: The show attracts a regular audience of about 20 million.
sentences.cn: 这个节目吸引了大约两千万固定观众收看。

sentences.en: The vast majority of the attentive audience applauded these sentiments.
sentences.cn: 大多数聚精会神听讲的观众都对这些观点表示赞赏。

sentences.en: They would always come out and warm up the audience.
sentences.cn: 他们总是会出来调动观众情绪。

sentences.en: Weber is challenging his audience to question their own beliefs.
sentences.cn: 韦伯正要求观众们反思质疑各自的信仰。

phrases.tran_cn: 受制而走不开的听众或观众
目标受众；目标观众；目标客户

trans.tran_cn: 观众，听众，读者，接见，会见
trans.tran_en: a group of people who come to watch and listen to someone speaking or performing in public
